pubStmt.avail:
THIS TEXT IS AVAILABLE THROUGHOUT THE WORLD only as part of the British National Corpus at nominal charge FOR ACADEMIC RESEARCH PURPOSES SUBJECT TO A SIGNED END USER LICENCE HAVING BEEN RECEIVED BY OXFORD UNIVERSITY COMPUTING SERVICES, from whom forms and supporting materials are available.
THIS TEXT IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR COMMERCIAL RESEARCH AND EXPLOITATION unless terms have first been agreed with the BNC Consortium Exploitation Committee. Apply in the first instance to Oxford University Computing Services.
It is your responsibility, as a user, to ensure that an End User Licence is in place. For your information, the Terms of the End User Licence are set out in the corpus header, which is likely to have a file name similar to "corphdr" or "CORPHDR".
Distribution of any part of the corpus under the terms of the Licence must include a copy of the corpus header. Distribution of this corpus text under the terms of the Licence must include this header embodying this notice.
THE EXACT CONDITIONS OF USE FOR THIS TEXT ARE NOT CURRENTLY KNOWN TO THE ARCHIVING AGENCY. PLEASE CONTACT THE DATA CAPTURE AGENCY NAMED IN THIS HEADER FOR FURTHER INFORMATION.

encDesc.projDesc: See the project description in the corpus header for information about the British National Corpus project.
encDesc.refsDecl: Canonical references in the British National Corpus are to text segment (<s>) elements, and are constructed by taking the value of the n attribute of the <cdif> element containing the target text, and concatenating a dot separator, followed by the value of the n attribute of the target <s> element.

respStmt.name: dominic

ptr.w: I didn't I didn't know if you'd be coming or not.

s.w: Mind you, you had a good week off didn't you?
Mm, bitter, it's like really biting up there
Yeah, how did Dan go on?
Erm, most of it grown, it'd grown back and it has grown back funny
My sideboard has grown back, it's grown back funny
you know, more like causing a blockage and that
So what did you like, what did you think about your week off then?
Me, liked it off thank you

ptr.w: Do you like it up there?

s.w: be in town, if you only go up and see her if you're in town couldn't you?
Oh God, he went in Sunday, Bill took him in at ten o'clock about sixteen mile here and sixteen mile back it is
so Sunday we went Sunday afternoon when
had got back we had to go back again, er Monday he had his operation so we didn't go in afternoon we went over the Metro Centre, but I couldn't settle, so we come back

ptr.w: When did he have his operation?

s.w: Joe said he went through night, he said I sat and come home in morning
so he come home Wednesday morning
and then he went back Monday for his stitches out
and then he's got a big packing, he can't have that out like tenth of February er so

ptr.w: So he was only in for a couple of days then?
It's like Peggy across the road

s.w: she had, she's had to have her breast off you know, she had cancer
and she had it er Tuesday
and I went across to see how she was and he says I'm expecting her home today, that were Thursday, so that was
It's not long enough you know
Yeah well, they let her home in a week you know
and right, they have a drainage thing on it
to fetch all badness, I mean it were all five of those bottle or four up in London
erm, you know like creamy stuff and that
anyway they were needed beds, so they sent her home, and er, you know er see that stuff that come away, you see there were still some stuff left to come away
and it finds a way to

ptr.w: and she was in a right mess

s.w: right in between stitches, it was all oozing out
One day she sat here and she had a T-shirt on Joyce
and yes she was just all covered
with all this stuff and she were like it were eh hard
It's like your dad were, weren't it, but he's, he had a hole in his back, so it ran up, and it used to fill up and it, every so often it would burst out wouldn't it

ptr.w: Yeah, you see it's just got to come away

s.w: She couldn't keep up with cloths and that for it

ptr.w: She had a right job did she with it?

s.w: but like somebody else that were in, erm, the, the bloody pressure were up so they kept them in cos of that
bottle on longer you see, while they were in and they were alright, and it
She had some right trouble because they, they sent her home too early, so
I did know they let her home, I didn't know she had her breast off though
erm, er in next bed to have, they've gotta have, well the
er in next bed to our Beryl
She's ever so bitter about it then
Yeah, she's about that age, yeah she is about that age
that little girl though, you know
fifty eight is worse age for breast cancer
er there's a bit of stew in there, would you like some of that heated up in microwave?
It's all that's left from yesterday
it's only vegetables in that, there's nothing fattening in it
Oh Joyce I'm not worried about oh fat in it anyway
I thought you were watching it like, you know
No I've eaten more bloody stuff while I were up there last week meant for a star, bought chocolate
Oh I was bored to tears and I was eating whole time
you said you were going up nearer
instead of just going, you should of said oh I just come up for a few days
Blair had to look after him Joy cos he were bad when he come home like
He come home Wednesday night, they went and picked him up
and er what did he do, got out of car, banged his bloody head on car

ptr.w: the very next day anyway I sent for a doctor

s.w: anyway doctor said she should, they shouldn't of even let you home
he said I can't believe it, I mean he had the operation Monday
he says er, it's a big operation that
cos like you go dizzy and that, it hits your balance you know what I mean and then
anyway, erm tt bloody smell smoke, making him feel sick
Oh so he couldn't have a smoke?
He didn't have a comfortable drag Joyce
Oh I feel so sorry for
Oh we've had er, there was this wait Chris rung us up, she's coming over in April
And then David's coming over and having three weeks, so she'll be over seven weeks
Yeah, I said yeah, I mean it is, I said, you come tomorrow if you like bedrooms are ready, but you see she'll be staying at her mum's some time
she'll be staying here and at her mum's but er
her mum really she's got a lot on, she'll have a lot on cos she's got to prepare for that wedding, you know what you're like when you, you've got
you know if you want, want to be doing things don't you get out of house and that

ptr.w: Yeah, pre preparing for a wedding, yeah aye

s.w: Just stop here now can you see caravan out on road?
right, have you heard owt from
no, er paid er his money
must of took whole lot of them
took all ground and everything off them
Yeah yeah, well they've got plenty of money breweries haven't they?
have some of mine if it's
We haven't been out for a drink us since, I think last time we went out New Year's Day
were down were hospital Sunday I says to her I tell what
and er you know we can have a drink, we'll go out and have a drink and have a meal like, anyway our John says oh
mum, I'm not bothered about going out, you know so
we've not been out now we us
we haven't been since Sunday dinner have we?
Oh not for a drink, no, no we haven't
What a difference it makes, it costs you at least ten pounds a night
so if you're staying a few nights some get some saved up don't you?

ptr.w: Yeah of course you can, I mean my mum haven't been out for weeks

s.w: well we, we stayed in a week when we had that cold didn't we?
We stayed in for a week
and then we started going out didn't we?
And we haven't been out this week either
No, but it's surprising how you, you get set you, you soon get used to it not going out

ptr.w: I mean he's used to going out, but he, you still get used to not going out as well don't you?

s.w: well it's been, the, the weather's not been fit has it?
I mean with his chest being bad he's
not been fit to go out
I mean we went to pick babe up five o'clock erm Saturday and I had to ring it were really freezing cold
cos they've had their car pinched
took the car keys to them
who got babe, they've only had car a month
and they were, Pip's in hospital
They went to see him Monday night, with all that fog, they come out and bloody car had gone
and er police rang them up Tuesday, cos er they found car at Great Alton, they went to pick it up, somebody had nicked it again
so erm it's a right bloody case

Just smash the lock, what they do, what, what that cop told us, oh that looks nice Joyce, they just erm get her things, put it on wall like that and then they just start it with wires, but it, that's what they trying to do with ours, but er they've either, either been disturbed or erm they, they took theirs, Monday night in all that fog

ptr.w: police rang them up this woman had rung him up, she's got a farm at Great Alton and

s.w: oh she says there's an Astra car here
in middle of field, so er anyway police came
and erm they said er oh it's been stolen like, rang our Wayne up, our Wayne went through to pick it up
and er gone again, somebody nicked it again
It's alright if you like in it, I put steak and kidney in it
seems to be ate tons of it today, eh
yeah we ate we right enjoyed it

ptr.w: It's nice and tasty though don't it?

s.w: Oh yeah, what you reckon Joy I did it cos we went to see his sister yesterday, cos he's only got one sister so we go and see her, see her regular and, she's not all that good is she in health?
So she said she's no car to come over here
we go over there and erm so I do, what I did I put that meat out to thaw the night before so it was thawed
so I thought well I'd put that in with some onion
and, so I did, you know, and, and pearl barley in it

and then er I thought oh I might as well put some veg in, you know, so I put some veg in, so when we, I says oh I'll do this, I'll do this stew, you know, nearly to finish it like, and erm when we come in we'll have a meal ready for us, it were right nice coming into it meal ready
Can be, how my hyacinth gone, look at it, the silly thing it's gone cock-eyed, can you see it
instead of growing up straight look one of those things has broke off on that Alec
I've got plants, quite a few plants upstairs, the only geraniums I've put in my greenhouse has died, must of been too cold for them
but I put some upstairs, good job, but I did loads didn't I all little cuttings, they were coming on a bit weren't they?
Yeah, I cooked a lasagne this morning, I thought well
just pop it in oven then when they come in
I've never done one of them
It's lovely Joyce it's really nice
do it with mince meat and it's cheap and erm, but my, erm chopped onions, I can't, I'm allergic to mushrooms, it's nice with mushrooms in, if you like mushrooms
erm chop my oni onio onions er onions up and erm, what do they call it?
Yeah, courgettes do a little brown frying
and then cut some bacon up, put that in saucepan just let it brown a bit
in a bit of fat, er soften onions, then put mince in, brown mince
erm a bit of garlic if you like garlic, we don't like it that much, so I get garlic salt that's not as strong
and the erm put a tin of tomatoes in
in er a spoon of tomato puree
with salt and pepper and that
er and then just put some er on bottom of a dish if you put a mixture

ptr.w: What like the mixture, yeah , mm

s.w: and then you make some white sauce up, you pour white sauce on top
and then I buy that lasagne that's already cooked, just in like strips
and I put the lo row, row of mixture of bolognese like
then some more white sauce, then another
white sauce and then just grate cheese on top
I don't think you'll like it though do you?
Mind you, he likes tomatoes he likes, he likes mince, he
likes onions, bacon and stuff like that
er it tastes really nice, I mean like, you can put carrots in it if you want
I mean like Alison she puts mushrooms in, she puts
puts all sorts, but we don't bother to buy all that

ptr.w: Mm, no, no we don't like peppers , I don't like peppers

s.w: but, I like that garlic salt, it's alright that
it's not strong or owt you know?
in that, so I've got a bag, I've got a bag of that erm stew pack you know, frozen, that's really handy that i n't it?
I put my meat in and er, and erm tt my onions

ptr.w: Is it like mixed veg like?

s.w: with all sorts in it, onions
turnip, carrots, er all, all the root veg like you know
so what I did I put another carrot in extra
and a couple of onions in extra and er
some celery what I got fresh, I cooked some of that cos that's what I got from that bloke

ptr.w: Oh that's good Joyce, very tasty

s.w: Is that that stuff I got?
you didn't grumble about it did you this time?

ptr.w: Is it in oven or on top?
I just did it in the pan on top

s.w: the burner and then simmered it, I put, didn't put my kidney in well, when I put my veg in
because kidney don't take as long to cook
But that stew meat I got that
we've got stew meat, we got erm lamb, I got, I don't know how many joints of lamb, I got er, I don't know how many joints of that er rib of beef you know?
and it's only ninety eight pence a pound, it's absolute gorgeous i n't it Alec?
Well it's rib of beef i nt it?
they don't call it that, but it is that i nt it?
That's what it is a rib of beef
cos I said to him can you, can you cut me small ones he said well they're from the rib of the beef he said and it depends on the size of the beef what size your
you know, and he brought this piece up, oh and it was pretty gorgeous, so Alec says how much is that piece?
And he said er ten pound weren't it, but it made four joints, yeah
lovely joints, you know like er with a bone and the, the meat

ptr.w: well I've seen it here and er honest it's oh so dear inn it?

s.w: yeah, yeah and it's really tasty isn't it?
Yeah we enjoyed it didn't we?
it will do me erm er, er Sunday joint a dinner and then there's some left for Monday and then there's some left for a stew you know
which I usually make it into

ptr.w: It's lovely that dress it'll go, gorgeous

s.w: Right, we'll be having all them erm

all them eggs you know, when we went to Alec, when they were selling these trays of eggs, er, we went there with Alec, so I said I'll have one like, and they were really fresh, but when I got home I got that thing of, from Kwiksave, I got the whole packet, big packet
so I'd got all that, I think it's forty odd eggs ain't I just
us two, we don't use many, so I made, I made quiches, I put them in raw in the freezer, you know ready just to cook
bring out and cook, I made sponge cakes, fruit cakes, er
Yorkshire pudding, I had to use them up didn't I, cos I don't like eggs laid about, you know, I don't like them being there a lot

ptr.w: Yeah, but if boil eggs they're alright
boil them we have we have, we don't eat many eggs, though, do what?
with the bread it's alright if you fried

s.w: Yeah, but I've had it, I mean I've had them a week now haven't I?

ptr.w: Oh I have them over a week eggs

s.w: I don't like to keep them too long eggs, you know, especially with this scare being on
Mm, mind you I never bother, I mean if you look in supermarket, erm, you know it has er best before, and it you know it's always a few months
Yeah I suppose it would of been alright like, but I don't like keeping them
and anyway this fellow said do you want some rabbit it's a pound each, so we ordered some rabbits, ain't got them yet like, but I don't know if we'll get them or not
After all there is Sunday dinner to go
so whether we'll get them or not, I don't know

ptr.w: we ordered ten so I don't know whether we'll get, maybe if we'd ordered two we might of got them, but er, ordering ten is a lot ain't it?

s.w: as soon as he can, eh
and er, oh is this it?
Oh brakes wants seeing to, a side light, the shock rears want doing
wheel bearings might want doing that bloke's
Oh is he gon na do it for you?
go down and see him, if he'll check mine over
So erm anyway goes in, I said to him other day, I asked him other week, he says our turn to give me a ring
anyway Bob said oh you'll see him on Friday, I says Bill is a busy bloke you know, I says you can't just go on Friday and expect to do it over weekend

ptr.w: he might of booked somebody else in

s.w: Yeah, well, I wouldn't ask him because I think it's too cold for poor devil to work, you know

ptr.w: Anyway , erm, I don't know where he's got all this lot from, somebody must of said at work that, what's wheel bearing er gate steering?

s.w: Dunno what that is, I mean oh we haven't got a clue, he's not got a clue on car, don't know where he's got that bloody lot from, so besides other things that want checking for MOT, I think he wants them to check
we ought to have somebody have a look at it

ptr.w: Well that cost a lot, but a bloody

s.w: well where've you got that from then Ann?
Oh that, they'll sort it out
cos there's not many cars in that yard when we passed
that's it, when we went past er that Sunday, was it Easter Sunday we went and

ptr.w: The, the, the thing was empty

s.w: No it was the weekend love I said oh next week then they're not

ptr.w: Perhaps weekend they're not working much in the week then

s.w: not all, but it were dead actually
anyway we, we paid our er, our rates for Mansfield
Mansfield breweries took them over now
so we had to take a hundred and twenty five pound off what we owed
and if we paid it before the end of January
we got twenty nine pounds summat off
nearly thirty pound off, so we did, took that off and I sent the rest
and I took my hundred and twenty five off
and I got my oh, oh would I, I couldn't wait to get my receipt back you know, anyway, I got my receipt back as well

ptr.w: Yeah well if you say you've paid by cheque that's

s.w: your receipt an' all i n't it?
Yeah I went out and got erm
got er nice little watch an Accurist watch with that money Dave sent, I thought if I don't it's gonna fritter away
Buy, she buys ladders with her money
Oh that's nice Joyce, oh it's gorgeous that
Yeah, got a small little face and
it had to change that for me, cos it was so big the other one
Aye, he said it's just er to stop it from slipping straight off
I said well it would do
that could jerk it out, the test to hold my hand out, and my get it on i n't it?
But er, he ain't spent his yet, I've spent mine, I've spent mine.

pause.w: Go on if you had a bloody some bloody stuff nicked last Saturday

s.w: He had some stuff nicked, a ski jacket which cost me seventy five quid it were half, the rest it should of been a hundred and fifty
I took her to school last week, anyway I think it were last Thursday

ptr.w: Thursday aye er, she come home and I said to her where's your ski jacket?

s.w: She says oh she says I've left it in sports hall, it's locked up in a locker
so erm tt so anyway Saturday we gets to Durham, she's says oh your Alex was just been on phone, she'd, she'd been up to school to do a hockey match
sports hall's been broke into er used a door bar and broke into all lockers, so her ski jacket's gone
Oh this is a joke in hell
so I told her to fetch them bloody home
I says there were no need for her to leave them there, we're gonna bloody create it
anyway she rang up have Alec told you?
Don't get no sympathy off me, when you gonna bleeding learn I says, you get things too easy that's your trouble, she says

ptr.w: Could she not could she not lock them up right

s.w: Oh er what else could she do then?
Oh, she could of fetched them home
Well I mean, you got your stuff lot, pinched you start your car didn't you?
She were laughing at me Joyce when it happened to me, I can't believe how stupid you are she said
and she said I don't like to tell time, she kept going, looking at me with a can't believe how stupid you are
And what, you'd got your car locked outside haven't you?
How did they get in then?
It were open that much you see
Oh so that's how they got in?
But she kept on saying how er stupid I was
They being quick though aren't they?
but you see they reckon it were that Sandra don't they?
she were parked at side of me
Yeah, anyway only her in when mine got pinched and, and erm Kath's got pinched and the police
and said there's nobody, we didn't see anybody, because her Carol parks the side of mine an' all, she'd gone
or get in and put her in her boot
I couldn't get out this morning, all the trouble, I've had a fortnight's troubles, he's there the week
Oh yeah, you've had a fortnight today won't you?
Mm it seems though it's funny not come in next, last week didn't it?
Yeah, oh Belinda's been going bloody crackers again
Oh I've never known anybody like her, er I think it's an
but, you know erm, I told you she ran subsidy didn't I?
A hundred and forty seven quid a week

ptr.w: Mm, well I think that's good

s.w: cos she got to three thousand or summat
and then she kept saying they owed her some money you know
anyway when I come back in one day, she says to me, she says listen to this, a neighbour were sat here
She says Chris, that's her in office, she's told me that I'm off the subsidy now, she says I've been on it twelve week and er
Mr manager at branch mean the area manager us, she said he's not even had the decency to tell me himself

she said Chris oh you're off the subsidy, she said I'd got my wages anyway, er because she'd only collected sixteen hundred and, hundred pounds so that, seven six are forty two, hundred and two pound you see
then they stop her this tax what she owes them all, well she's been getting a hundred and forty seven
and she says that, oh this is wrong Chris
she says er I'm er guaranteed, she says oh no you're not, she says Ruth's told me last week to take you off guarantee, so they took her off like

ptr.w: Who is , who is this on in, on guarantee

s.w: oh and took her off and David says to me she's a bloody fool to have sent, says instead of keeping her mouth shut, she's, there's George claim nowt, you know what I mean?
George is saying things to him and they're saying you can't do this and they can't do that, well they can do what they want can't they?
So they took our subs in
What can she do about it?
cos she, she kept saying that they owed her
she didn't cos working it out by week
she's quids in i n't she?
and as the trustee so she bloody guaranteeing a hundred and forty seven pound
it off her and I said she's going mad
Yeah, you know if, if they alter your round
if they alter your round, er and it's not collecting as much
so, you know, to give chance, chance to go
usually it's twelve month, usually they put you on guarantee while you're earning that much

they've gave us since we've been creating that much she's had been in to see Mr she said and he says oh no he says er that's not right Brenda, he says er mine are all guaranteed until they're earning that money he says you can't just do it
anyway er David said he'll get in touch with us to see what's going on
and erm tt, he says well he says she did enough creating about it, he says, so
Well if she wanted to earn her own money
she did alright though i n't it?
When she gonna pack up work?
She'll never pack up Joyce, she won't, she'll never pack up
Mind you I shouldn't talk I worked until I was sixty

ptr.w: Instead of sitting there you're knitting

s.w: Pearl did my round, she did well last week, David did Friday, but she did Monday and Thursday
and er she worked Monday and Thursday and er what did she get fourteen hundred so it
she get ninety eight quid plus her own money what she earned doing her round
herself, so she'll get her own money plus ninety eight quid for doing my round for two days
No David did here, she just did
Ascot, cos she lives at Ascot

vocal.w: Tell him, said Jo said you never called in for a quick , I don't mind David he's alright

s.w: Yeah he's alright, he's, he probably didn't set off
Yeah, probably did it in a few hours

ptr.w: picked his stuff up before it finished

s.w: Mm, does it take much doing?

ptr.w: Yeah if they're in but like it's compact really i n't it?

s.w: oh yeah it is you know
It is compact because I mean I used to do Stamford as well
so I mean like I go down here, I do some off Broadway and then I nip down
like all of Broadway you know?
in Broadway and you just nip in end of that
then I'll go round er Oval
then as I come out of Oval

ptr.w: How did you find out how did you find Annie in?
Oh shuffling out, he's going round and round her David

s.w: Cos you know last week she, er, she's had all sorts for Christmas, it's er
you ought to see what she er, you ought to see her outfit she's got, she's nearly going around er, oh he, he can see her with different outfits on

ptr.w: Yeah how, she got all these bloody vouchers off me at Christmas you know

s.w: erm shopping vouchers where you can go to different places

ptr.w: and I let her have two loans

s.w: and erm then she wanted some more Argos vouchers so I'll have them
so anyway she said anyway er she's had this bloody Aga put in, you know she had that other Aga in didn't she?
It's run on solid fuel, it's a cooker
and it heats your oven up, it's got all temperature thing on it a hot, hot plate, she had one before

ptr.w: Oh yeah, oh she had one of them put in

s.w: Yeah, but it weren't smokeless so she's had to change it
and it's cost them two thousand pound
Well I went not last Friday but the Friday before, they were doing it
they'd got it in right, cos she was showing me how it worked and that, all
control, but it's run on coke
anyway she says oh she says it's gonna be a feature here, it's a beauty, I mean I don't like old line, I don't, you know for the money what they costs, cooker

ptr.w: Yeah, no, I think it's too much i n't it?

s.w: and, but she says like it, you know what I mean like
Er that's run off her fire now, that's not run off it, that's just for a cooker that
Well no it for the, the heating's swapped over cos
I was gonna say cos I think Jackie said hers was five hundred, but of course maybe it isn't

ptr.w: But might of been might of been more because erm, tt she's had a, a grant for so much

s.w: Cos she only paid two thousand for house
and she had a grant for so much off the council
They're brick houses you know that's why she had a grant?

ptr.w: You see er she can have one because

s.w: her, her fire won't burn coke, but ours will because ours is an Atlas

ptr.w: she says she says to me just take thirty pound, the, there were, I think there's about seven quid that belongs to their bed, well their bed was bloody horrible to pay

s.w: I wished that, is she still on?
She has, but it's in Annie's name
Oh what she spends every year
and anyway she rang David up and she said, she didn't say it were for Bet but she said she wanted another two hundred pounds
in vouchers, so he said yes, and then she tell me she said our dad will give me money, she said the, the to help out with that, she'll have about three holidays next year
and then, then he said to me
he'd been round last Friday, on Thursday she rang
up and she wanted five hundred pounds
hairdresser an er she'll, it would of cost so much to get car and she needed car doing, this, that and the other, and David refused her and when he went on Friday
key were in lock, but it were locked door
he said I know she'll in
of course since Christmas she's not paid full money
and yet she's saying I'm gonna make this a feature, I'm having erm an archway over my Aga and erm, I mean she's got a new carpet you know

ptr.w: she er think should be eleven quid a week on carpet, she had an old carpet
She paying eleven pound a week for that house in

s.w: yeah, she pays eleven, eleven pound a week then?

ptr.w: cos she wanted it on sixty weeks
cos she's had er patio doors put in her big room
